categories.name: Carson City Morgans
categories.description: Coins from the legendary Carson City Mint (1878-1893). Highly prized by collectors for their Wild West heritage.

categories.name: Morgan Dollars
categories.description: America's most collected silver dollar series (1878-1921). Classic designs by George T. Morgan.

categories.name: Peace Dollars
categories.description: America's last circulating silver dollar (1921-1935). Symbol of post-WWI optimism.

categories.name: Walking Liberty Halves
categories.description: Considered one of the most beautiful US coin designs (1916-1947). Designed by Adolph Weinman.

categories.name: Barber Half Dollars
categories.description: Classic Liberty Head design by Charles Barber (1892-1915). Popular with type collectors.

categories.name: Capped Bust Half Dollars
categories.description: Early American coinage (1807-1839). Historic pieces from the early US Mint.

coins.name: 1881-CC Morgan Dollar BU
coins.description: A stunning example from the Carson City Mint with excellent luster and eye appeal. The 1881-CC had a low mintage of only 296,000 coins, making it one of the scarcer CC Morgans. This piece displays beautiful frosty surfaces.

coins.name: 1895 Morgan Dollar
coins.description: The 'King of Morgan Dollars' - only 12,880 proofs were struck with no business strikes confirmed. This is one of the most sought-after dates in the entire Morgan series. Contact us for pricing and authentication details.

coins.name: 1893 Morgan Dollar
coins.description: A scarce Philadelphia issue with low mintage. The 1893 is an underrated semi-key date that often gets overshadowed by the famous 1893-S. Shows honest circulation with good remaining detail.

coins.name: 1896-O Morgan Dollar

images.obverse: /images/products/1896 O Morgan Silver Dollar Obverse (2020_10_06 13_13_11 UTC).JPG
images.reverse: /images/products/1896 O Morgan Silver Dollar Reverse (2020_10_06 13_13_11 UTC).JPG

coins.description: New Orleans Mint Morgan with good detail for the grade. The 1896-O is a semi-key date that's challenging to find in higher grades. A solid addition to any Morgan collection.

coins.name: 1878 Morgan Dollar (Philadelphia)
coins.description: First year of the Morgan Dollar series. This Philadelphia Mint example shows lovely detail and minimal wear. A must-have for type collectors and those building a Morgan set.

coins.name: 1878-S Morgan Dollar
coins.description: First year San Francisco Morgan in brilliant uncirculated condition. Known for typically strong strikes, this example displays excellent detail and luster.

coins.name: 1921-D Morgan Dollar (Zerbe Proof)

images.obverse: /images/products/1921 D Morgan Silver Dollar Obverse Proof.Zerbe (2020_10_06 13_13_11 UTC).JPG
images.reverse: /images/products/1921 D Morgan Silver Dollar Reverse ProofZerbe (2020_10_06 13_13_11 UTC).JPG

coins.description: An extraordinary coin - purportedly a Zerbe Proof from 1921-D. Farran Zerbe was the ANA's first paid numismatist who commissioned special strikings. If authenticated, this would be an exceptional rarity. Contact for details.

coins.name: 1922 Peace Dollar BU
coins.description: Beautiful BU 1922 Peace Dollar, the most common date in the series but a classic design. Each coin contains 0.77344 troy oz of pure silver. Price based on current silver spot plus premium.

coins.name: 1922 Peace Dollar Deep Strike MS

images.obverse: /images/products/1922 Peace Dollar MS Deep Strike Obverse (2020_10_06 13_13_11 UTC).JPG
images.reverse: /images/products/1922 Peace Dollar MS Deep Strike Reverse (2020_10_06 13_13_11 UTC).JPG

coins.description: An exceptional 1922 Peace Dollar with notably deep strike showing all hair detail. While 1922 is a common date, pieces with full strike like this command a premium among collectors.

coins.name: 1925 Peace Dollar Choice Gem BU

images.obverse: /images/products/1925 Choice Gem BU Peace Silver Dollar Obverse (2020_10_06 13_13_11 UTC).JPG
images.reverse: /images/products/1925 Choice Gem BU Peace Silver Dollar Reverse (2020_10_06 13_13_11 UTC).JPG

coins.description: A stunning gem quality 1925 Peace Dollar with exceptional luster and minimal marks. The 1925 is known for well-struck examples, and this piece exemplifies that reputation.

coins.name: 1926-S Peace Dollar Die Crack Error XF

images.obverse: /images/products/1926 S Peace Dollar Die Crack Error XF Obverse (2020_10_06 13_13_11 UTC).JPG
images.reverse: /images/products/1926 S Peace Dollar Die Crack Error XF Reverse (2020_10_06 13_13_11 UTC).JPG

coins.description: An interesting 1926-S Peace Dollar displaying a visible die crack error. Error coins are popular with collectors who appreciate the unique characteristics of coins struck from damaged dies.

coins.name: 1810 Capped Bust Half Dollar

images.obverse: /images/products/1810 Capped Bust Half Dollar Obverse (2020_10_06 13_13_11 UTC).JPG
images.reverse: /images/products/1810 Capped Bust Half Dollar Reverse (2020_10_06 13_13_11 UTC).JPG

coins.description: A beautiful early American half dollar from 1810, featuring John Reich's classic Capped Bust design. This piece represents over 200 years of American history.

coins.name: 1811 Capped Bust Half Dollar

images.obverse: /images/products/1811 Capped Bust Half Dollar Obverse (2020_10_06 13_13_11 UTC).JPG
images.reverse: /images/products/1811 Capped Bust Half Dollar Reverse (2020_10_06 13_13_11 UTC).JPG

coins.description: An attractive 1811 Capped Bust Half Dollar with nice eye appeal for the grade. These early halves are highly collectible and represent a fascinating period in US Mint history.

coins.name: 1916 Walking Liberty Half Dollar
coins.description: First year of Adolph Weinman's magnificent Walking Liberty design, widely considered one of the most beautiful US coin designs ever created. The 1916 Philadelphia issue is a key date with low mintage.

coins.name: 1916-D Walking Liberty Half (Reverse Mint Mark)

images.obverse: /images/products/1916 D Reverse Variety Half Dollar Obverse (2020_10_06 13_13_11 UTC).JPG
images.reverse: /images/products/1916 D Reverse Variety Half Dollar Reverse (2020_10_06 13_13_11 UTC).JPG

coins.description: First year Denver Mint Walking Liberty with the mint mark on the reverse (moved to obverse in 1917). This variety is collectible as it represents the original design intent.

coins.name: 1917-S Walking Liberty Half (Obverse Mint Mark) XF

images.obverse: /images/products/1917 S Obverse Variety Half Dollar XF Obverse (2020_10_06 13_13_11 UTC).JPG
images.reverse: /images/products/1917 S Obverse Variety Half Dollar XF Reverse (2020_10_06 13_13_11 UTC).JPG

coins.description: A scarce 1917-S Walking Liberty with the obverse mint mark variety. The mint mark was moved to the obverse in 1917, creating both obverse and reverse varieties that year.

coins.name: 1892-S Barber Half Dollar
coins.description: First year San Francisco Barber Half Dollar. The 1892-S is a semi-key date with lower mintage than the Philadelphia issue. Shows good detail with honest wear.

coins.name: 1893-S Barber Half Dollar
coins.description: A scarce 1893-S Barber Half Dollar with low mintage of only 740,000 coins. A solid example for the Barber Half collector building a date set.
